name: sfchronicle
text:
Los Altos became the latest Bay Area city to reopen playgrounds — with numerous rules, such as limiting visits to 30 minutes and requiring face masks.

https://t.co/4GRINCxyIe

name: sfchronicle
text: SJSU will host the Air Force Academy Saturday night, marking a late season opener for the Spartans. The team had to restart their season twice in August and September due to the record number of consecutive Spare-the-Air alerts that were issued. https://t.co/Mr63Jk3EN0

name: sfchronicle
text:
Gilroy school officials are urging all district students aged 14 to 18 to get tested for the coronavirus, after a large party was hosted where at least one attendee later tested positive.

https://t.co/p2sv0YJMcH

name: sfchronicle
text: Robot cars are revving up, but are still far from meeting predictions that self-driving vehicles would be mainstream by 2020. Cruise, Waymo and Lyft are among those doing extensive testing in San Francisco. https://t.co/O8H0BugR7m

name: sfchronicle
text: JUST IN: Marty Obst, a top aide to Vice President Mike Pence, tested positive for the coronavirus this week, according to several media reports. https://t.co/JyOYa9321j

name: sfchronicle
text: Andrzej Duda, 48, the president of Poland, has become the latest world leader to test positive for the coronavirus, NPR reported. He is self-isolating and has no symptoms. https://t.co/tOvQTsQ2ak

name: sfchronicle
text:
Update: Drivers asked to continue avoiding I-80 in Richmond hours after fiery tanker truck accident. A shelter in place order was mostly, but not entirely, lifted by early evening.

https://t.co/OYD5sqoYoB

name: sfchronicle
text:
PG&E expects 386,000 homes and businesses to see power outages, down from about 466,000 previously expected. PG&E meteorologist Scott Strenfel said that it was expected to be the “strongest Diablo and fire weather event of the season so far.”

https://t.co/UdA4lljayO

name: sfchronicle
text:
Max Muncy is far removed from his days with the Oakland A’s, but the dismissal remains a major piece of his journey that has gotten him to two wins from a World Series championship.

https://t.co/hNZwCplAgn

name: sfchronicle
text:
PG&E shutoffs could impact almost 25,000 customers who depend on electricity for medical devices. 

The company has so far confirmed 95% of these customers are aware of the outage risk, and will knock on doors and conduct wellness checks with others.

https://t.co/NK7Pvcgifs

name: sfchronicle
text:
Many polling organizations are forecasting a big win for Joe Biden over Donald Trump in the 2020 presidential election.

Those same organizations, however, forecasted a Hillary Clinton victory in 2016. https://t.co/eEZemLftOT

name: sfchronicle
text:
Review: Nicole Krauss’ radiant new story collection is both a return and departure.

From @SFC_Datebook: https://t.co/1AHojm34DT https://t.co/zZx2L4cK82

name: sfchronicle
text:
The party was held Oct. 16 and involved about 200 students from Christopher High School and Gilroy High School, officials from the Gilroy Unified School District said. 

https://t.co/4f4tCfKnfw

name: sfchronicle
text: A huge, overlooked wildfire threat to homes is something very small. https://t.co/wc8qdyzOPh

name: sfchronicle
text: While some Democrats see parallels to 2016 in the waning days of this campaign, analysts say there are some crucial differences that make Donald Trump’s path to victory far more treacherous. https://t.co/8PdYDcFHNr

text:

text:
Two things to know about “Borat Subsequent Moviefilm” — from film critic @MickLaSalle:

1. It's appalling 

2. I haven’t laughed this hard at anything in months 

https://t.co/ZnvQsYeWeu

https://t.co/w1T01zHhHn

text: Here’s who Gavin Newsom could name to replace Kamala Harris in the Senate: https://t.co/b7n8ZyVNpw

name: sfchronicle
text: In a year defined by uncertainty, Civic Center is a place where fenced-in tents for homeless people fill one block and a circus-scale early voting center fills another, writes @JohnKingSFChron. https://t.co/8HCp7LqlBG

name: sfchronicle
text: The National Weather Service said winds will be strongest starting at 6 p.m. tonight and lasting until at least 7 a.m. — and potentially until 10 a.m. — Monday morning.  https://t.co/H3EcyVaYq9 https://t.co/KYsR7SEra4

name: sfchronicle
text: Today's front page: the stories San Francisco is talking about this morning. https://t.co/sgK7iFvtYo https://t.co/QJLMIQ5dDa

name: sfchronicle
text: Once known for calm and quiet, the eastern Oakland hills are exploding almost nightly with semiautomatic gunfire, reports @philmatier. https://t.co/FtiyJZQ5QV

name: sfchronicle
text:
“The other night we heard shots at 8:30, 9:30, 10:30 — all night long. And not just one or two shots, but multiple rounds from what sounds like automatic weapons,” one hills resident said. “It’s like a de facto shooting range.” 

https://t.co/vpe1iwjWKq

name: sfchronicle
text:
Temperatures near Lake Tahoe are about to plunge into the single digits. It’s related to the weather pattern that is bringing high winds and extreme fire risk to the Bay Area.

https://t.co/3XCV4tMtLa

name: sfchronicle
text: Interactive map: Tracking the events that led to a firefighter's death in August Complex fire. Volunteer firefighter Diana Jones, who came from Texas to battle the blaze, died when shifting winds turned a slowly progressing fire into a deadly inferno. https://t.co/GYMHayLcco https://t.co/w4RJYz1jwx

name: sfchronicle
text: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said she’s not giving up on passing another coronavirus relief package by Nov. 3. A new bill could send another $1,200 to most Americans, restart bonus unemployment benefits, and allocate money to state and local governments. https://t.co/nmo4eYGjsW https://t.co/XWW1Rpasp0

name: sfchronicle
text:
If you visit Civic Center as election day nears, the district's high-minded architecture is no match for the turbulent grind of this calendar year, which is like none that we have ever encountered.

@JohnKingSFChron's column: https://t.co/aPULypHM3d

name: sfchronicle
text:
Is Kamala Harris a cop or progressive? A Berkeley radical or Beltway insider?

Chronicled: Who Is Kamala Harris is a podcast on the making of a candidate.

Listen to the trailer and subscribe now: https://t.co/lpZVIUtK8o https://t.co/GOPIcNvCOR

name: sfchronicle
text:
🎧 Chronicled: Who Is Kamala Harris? 🎧

Coming soon:
https://t.co/GqB6qFOURM

text:
No unit was more consistent for the A’s than their bullpen in 2020. It’s possible no unit will feature more significant changes in 2021.

https://t.co/p7j5wrdvhc

text: A 30-year-old San Pablo man was arrested early Sunday in Petaluma on suspicion of intentionally striking an on-duty firefighter with a vehicle, police said. https://t.co/U4pxk1VKXp

name: sfchronicle
text: San Leandro police critically wounded a 43-year-old man late Saturday night after a traffic stop and pursuit near San Leandro High School, according to authorities. https://t.co/A3LWxRDWU3 https://t.co/mGysIn79d9

name: sfchronicle
text:
Instead of choosing your Halloween-night movie based on holiday tradition, tailor your choice to the dimensions, flaws and tripwires of your own psyche — writes @micklasalle.
https://t.co/uaVOlSMf8M

name: sfchronicle
text: Authorities said firefighters made progress Saturday night on the Pope Fire, which has burned 61 acres and is 80% contained in St. Helena. Cal Fire didn’t offer an estimate for full containment. https://t.co/t1KbCnZcVw https://t.co/svsP4Qa05r

name: sfchronicle
text: Senate Republicans voted overwhelmingly Sunday to advance Supreme Court nominee Amy Coney Barrett toward final confirmation on Monday. https://t.co/8jmjIA0vjk https://t.co/1nctuJd95x

name: sfchronicle
text: Sonoma County is still stuck in the purple tier indicating “widespread” virus risk. Here’s why: https://t.co/Cj3WjiaHfQ

name: sfchronicle
text:
Once known for calm and quiet, the eastern Oakland hills are exploding almost nightly with semiautomatic gunfire. 

One theory is it’s gang members and others taking target practice before returning to their turf, writes @philmatier. https://t.co/tmUGoxfx2y

name: sfchronicle
text: PG&E issued a Public Safety Power Shut-off warning throughout most of Northern California, including all of the Bay Area except S.F., amid increasingly dangerous fire conditions and multiple Red Flag Warnings. An estimated 360,000 customers may lose power. https://t.co/Uo4ghK6Jcq https://t.co/NNoLHfdM4v

text: This game is more of a chess game than most NFL games, @scottostler writes. https://t.co/3868TPPJ7d
